definition: to cross over/to transcend/to cover distance/to overcome/to rise above
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: The one hundred and first meridian was passed.
sentences.chinese: 现在已经越过了经线一百零一度了。

sentences.english: He drilled the ball past the pitcher.
sentences.chinese: 他使球越过投手直飞过去。

sentences.english: The new bridge over the railroad tracks eliminated danger in cros, sing.
sentences.chinese: 这座新垮越铁轨的桥免除了越过铁轨时的危险。

sentences.english: The inside left is passing the opposing side's fullback line.
sentences.chinese: 这左辅正越过对方的后卫线。

sentences.english: Drop everything, cross that river, help your brothers.
sentences.chinese: 丢下手上的一切，越过那条河，去帮助我们的兄弟们。

sentences.english: He attempted a short cut over a hill to the school. (adj.
sentences.chinese: 他尝试着越过山走近道去学校。

sentences.english: Three days later, many people went over the wall, we have not encountered rous .
sentences.chinese: 三天后，许多人越过墙，没有遇到任何事。

sentences.english: I remember Thierry Henry flicking a ball over his head and scoring.
sentences.chinese: 我记得亨利轻挑一个球越过他头顶，然后破门。

sentences.english: Write a book, cross the ocean, take a new job, change your pace. ------ William James.
sentences.chinese: 写一本书，越过大洋，接受新工作，变换你的步调。

sentences.english: After ten years of careful preparations, he attacked and finally conquered the State of Wu.
sentences.chinese: 经过十年艰苦奋斗，越过终于雪耻战胜吴国。

sentences.english: Bridget poured cold water on the idea of crossing the mountains in winter, pointing out all the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 了所有的困难，对冬天越过丛山的主意泼了一瓢冷水。

sentences.english: A girl up to four of the rubber band is also gently over.
sentences.chinese: 一个女生高达四级的皮筋也轻轻越过。

sentences.english: He picked out Wazza, and he stretched his leg out and managed to guide it past the keeper.
sentences.chinese: 他将球挑给鲁尼，后者伸长了腿，让球越过了门将。

sentences.english: They went across the desert and into China.
sentences.chinese: 他们越过沙漠，然后到达中国。

sentences.english: Once the thief’s car passed across the state border, our state police had no jurisdiction to follow him.
sentences.chinese: 一旦窃贼的车越过州界，本州的警察便无权跟踪他。

definition: to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
to climb over/to get over (difficulties)/to scale/to surmount
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
flat land one could gallop straight across (idiom); wide expanse of flat country
to press on towards/to close in on/to approach/to draw near
